title: Awesome List Updates on Nov 21, 2024
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Nov 21, 2024 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Embedded Rust
items.content_text:
### Tools / Paid and commercially available materials

*   [xargo (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/japaric/xargo) Rust package manager with support for non-default std libraries ‚Äî build Rust runtime for your embedded system.
    *   xargo is great, but since it's in maintenance mode, [cargo-xbuild (‚≠ê264)](https://github.com/rust-osdev/cargo-xbuild) is catching up as its intended replacement.
*   [Knurling Tools](https://knurling.ferrous-systems.com/tools/) are developed by [Ferrous Systems](https://ferrous-systems.com) to ease the development process for building, debugging, and testing embedded Rust systems. These tools include:
    *   [defmt (‚≠ê1k)](https://github.com/knurling-rs/defmt): a highly efficient logging framework that targets resource-constrained devices, like microcontrollers.
    *   [derive-mmio (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/knurling-rs/derive-mmio): Creating MMIO-friendly APIs for embedded peripherals.
    *   [flip-link (‚≠ê350)](https://github.com/knurling-rs/flip-link), a linker wrapper that provides stack overflow protection without an MMU by flipping the standard memory layout of ARM Cortex-M programs
    *   [app-template (‚≠ê358)](https://github.com/knurling-rs/app-template), a `cargo-generate` powered project template for quickly setting up new projects using the Knurling Tools.
    *   [defmt-test (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/knurling-rs/defmt-test), an embedded test harness that lets you write and run unit tests as if you were using the built-in `#[test]` attribute, but will run on an embedded target

### Real-time / Real-time tools

*   [RTIC v1.0](https://rtic.rs/1/book/en/) Real-Time Interrupt-driven Concurrency ‚Äî A concurrency framework for building real-time systems:
    *   [cortex-m rtic (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/rtic-rs/cortex-m-rtic) RTIC framework for ARM Cortex-M microcontrollers
    *   [msp430 rtfm (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/japaric/msp430-rtfm) RTFM framework for MSP430 MCUs

### Peripheral Access Crates / MSP430

*   [`msp430g2553`](https://github.com/pftbest/msp430g2553) Peripheral access API for MSP430G2553 microcontrollers (generated using svd2rust)
    *   [msp430 quickstart (‚≠ê44)](https://github.com/rust-embedded/msp430-quickstart) some examples for msp430

### HAL implementation crates / STMicroelectronics

*   [`stm32f4xx-hal`](https://crates.io/crates/stm32f4xx-hal) - [![crates.io](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/stm32f4xx-hal.svg)](https://crates.io/crates/stm32f4xx-hal)
    *   Generic HAL implementation for all MCUs of the stm32f4 series
*   [`stm32f7xx-hal`](https://crates.io/crates/stm32f7xx-hal) - [![crates.io](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/stm32f7xx-hal.svg)](https://crates.io/crates/stm32f7xx-hal)
    *   Generic HAL implementation for all MCUs of the stm32f7 series
*   [`stm32h7xx-hal`](https://crates.io/crates/stm32h7xx-hal) - [![crates.io](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/stm32h7xx-hal.svg)](https://crates.io/crates/stm32h7xx-hal)
    *   HAL implementation for the STMicro STM32H7xx family of microcontrollers
*   [`stm32l0xx-hal`](https://crates.io/crates/stm32l0xx-hal) - [![crates.io](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/stm32l0xx-hal.svg)](https://crates.io/crates/stm32l0xx-hal)
    *   HAL implementation for the the STMicro STM32L0xx family of microcontrollers
*   [`stm32l4xx-hal`](https://crates.io/crates/stm32l4xx-hal) - [![crates.io](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/stm32l4xx-hal.svg)](https://crates.io/crates/stm32l4xx-hal)
    *   Generic hal support for stm32l4 devices, has examples that can run on boards like the [Nucleo-L432KC](https://www.st.com/content/st_com/en/products/evaluation-tools/product-evaluation-tools/mcu-eval-tools/stm32-mcu-eval-tools/stm32-mcu-nucleo/nucleo-l432kc.html), [Solo](https://solokeys.com/), and similar boards
*   [`stm32-hal`](https://crates.io/crates/stm32-hal2) - [![crates.io](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/stm32-hal2.svg)](https://crates.io/crates/stm32-hal2)
    *   HAL implementation for STM32 devices across multiple families, with a focus on newer ones like L4, L5, and H7.

### HAL implementation crates / MSP430

*   [`msp430fr2x5x-hal`](https://crates.io/crates/msp430fr2x5x-hal)
    *   HAL implementation for the MSP430FR2x5x family of microcontrollers

### HAL implementation crates / Silicon Labs

*   [`tomu-hal`](https://github.com/fudanchii/imtomu-rs)
    *   HAL implementation targeted for [Tomu](https://tomu.im/) USB board with EFM32HG309F64 ARMv6-M core. Has support to configure [tomu bootloader (‚≠ê75)](https://github.com/im-tomu/tomu-bootloader) directly from an application via the `toboot_config` macro.
items.content_html:
Tools / Paid and commercially available materials

  • xargo (‚≠ê1.1k) Rust package manager with support for non-default std libraries ‚Äî build Rust runtime for your embedded system.
    • xargo is great, but since it's in maintenance mode, cargo-xbuild (‚≠ê264) is catching up as its intended replacement.
  • Knurling Tools are developed by Ferrous Systems to ease the development process for building, debugging, and testing embedded Rust systems. These tools include:
    • defmt (‚≠ê1k): a highly efficient logging framework that targets resource-constrained devices, like microcontrollers.
    • derive-mmio (‚≠ê9): Creating MMIO-friendly APIs for embedded peripherals.
    • flip-link (‚≠ê350), a linker wrapper that provides stack overflow protection without an MMU by flipping the standard memory layout of ARM Cortex-M programs
    • app-template (‚≠ê358), a cargo-generate powered project template for quickly setting up new projects using the Knurling Tools.
    • defmt-test (‚≠ê9), an embedded test harness that lets you write and run unit tests as if you were using the built-in #[test] attribute, but will run on an embedded target

Real-time / Real-time tools

  • RTIC v1.0 Real-Time Interrupt-driven Concurrency ‚Äî A concurrency framework for building real-time systems:
    • cortex-m rtic (‚≠ê2k) RTIC framework for ARM Cortex-M microcontrollers
    • msp430 rtfm (‚≠ê11) RTFM framework for MSP430 MCUs

Peripheral Access Crates / MSP430

  • msp430g2553 Peripheral access API for MSP430G2553 microcontrollers (generated using svd2rust)
    • msp430 quickstart (‚≠ê44) some examples for msp430

HAL implementation crates / STMicroelectronics

  • stm32f4xx-hal -
    • Generic HAL implementation for all MCUs of the stm32f4 series
  • stm32f7xx-hal -
    • Generic HAL implementation for all MCUs of the stm32f7 series
  • stm32h7xx-hal -
    • HAL implementation for the STMicro STM32H7xx family of microcontrollers
  • stm32l0xx-hal -
    • HAL implementation for the the STMicro STM32L0xx family of microcontrollers
  • stm32l4xx-hal -
    • Generic hal support for stm32l4 devices, has examples that can run on boards like the Nucleo-L432KC, Solo, and similar boards
  • stm32-hal -
    • HAL implementation for STM32 devices across multiple families, with a focus on newer ones like L4, L5, and H7.

HAL implementation crates / MSP430

  • msp430fr2x5x-hal
    • HAL implementation for the MSP430FR2x5x family of microcontrollers

HAL implementation crates / Silicon Labs

  • tomu-hal
    • HAL implementation targeted for Tomu USB board with EFM32HG309F64 ARMv6-M core. Has support to configure tomu bootloader (‚≠ê75) directly from an application via the toboot_config macro.

items.title: Awesome Angular
items.content_text:
### General / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-forms-core (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/Juulsgaard/ngx-forms-core) - This library provides strictly typed versions of the Angular form system. The classes extend the Angular form system and provide several tools to improve type strictness.

### Form Controls / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-mat-split-button (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/feature23/ngx-mat-split-button) - A split button component for Angular Material. Split buttons (also known as "split button dropdowns" in Bootstrap) have a primary action button with a conjoined dropdown toggle that opens a menu for secondary actions.

### Markdown / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-textile (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/vincent/ngx-textile) - Use the Textile markup language in your Angular project using [textile-js (‚≠ê213)](https://github.com/borgar/textile-js).

### Mixed utilities / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-utility (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/OPI-PIB/ngx-utility) - Various helpers for forms, zones, DOM manipulation, HTTP requests, and more.
*   [ssv.ngx (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/sketch7/ssv.ngx) - Mono-repo of libraries from [sketch7](https://github.com/sketch7). [ngx.command (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/sketch7/ssv.ngx/tree/master/libs/ngx.command#readme) is a command pattern implementation for Angular. [ngx.ux (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/sketch7/ssv.ngx/blob/master/libs/ngx.ux/README.md) provides UX essentials and utilities for building apps.
items.content_html:
General / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-forms-core (‚≠ê1) - This library provides strictly typed versions of the Angular form system. The classes extend the Angular form system and provide several tools to improve type strictness.

Form Controls / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-mat-split-button (‚≠ê2) - A split button component for Angular Material. Split buttons (also known as "split button dropdowns" in Bootstrap) have a primary action button with a conjoined dropdown toggle that opens a menu for secondary actions.

Markdown / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-textile (‚≠ê1) - Use the Textile markup language in your Angular project using textile-js (‚≠ê213).

Mixed utilities / Google Developer Experts

  • ngx-utility (‚≠ê1) - Various helpers for forms, zones, DOM manipulation, HTTP requests, and more.
  • ssv.ngx (‚≠ê2) - Mono-repo of libraries from sketch7. ngx.command (‚≠ê2) is a command pattern implementation for Angular. ngx.ux (‚≠ê2) provides UX essentials and utilities for building apps.

items.title: Awesome for Beginners
items.content_text:
### Python * [FastAPI (‚≠ê87k)](https://github.com/tiangolo/fastapi) *(label: good first issue)*
A modern, fast (high-performance) web framework for building APIs with Python 3.6+ based on standard Python type hints.
items.content_html:
Python

  • FastAPI (‚≠ê87k) (label: good first issue)
    A modern, fast (high-performance) web framework for building APIs with Python 3.6+ based on standard Python type hints.
